page.title: 13Upper and Nether Padley
page.content: "Sir William Hill", on the Grindleford to Hathersage road is an example and Nether Padley may have been derived from the name 'PADDA' and become known as Padda's clearing. Nether Padley is now a civil parish having it's own parish council. We are fortunate in having a member of that council, who lives on the main Grindleford to Calver road, who has given us much local information. He is Alan Jacques, who is keeper of the village archives, as was his father before him. One very interesting fact which has come to light recently is the plan to amalgamate the parishes of Stoke, Eyam Woodlands, Nether Padley and Upper Padley to form a single civil parish of Grindleford. It is felt that this would unite the formerly fragmented parish situation and ensure a feeling of belonging to one community.
